intro: Lepanthes montis-narae, commonly known as the mountain naras orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. This epiphytic plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as red, yellow, or orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and relies on tree canopies for support. The plant's roots are adapted to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
